result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley N Barton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine, costs, DNA surcharge within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
11:40 a.m. Defendant Ashley N Barton in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Ct 1: $25 fine + costs + Drug & DNA surcharges. Counts 2 & 3 to be DRI
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Ct 1: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Counts 2 & 3 are Dismissed and Read In.

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler concurs with joint agreement.  

BY THE COURT: ********
$25 fine + costs + DNA surcharge

2:16 p.m. Defendant Ashley N Barton in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 
P/NG entered.
Bond is continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 10:30 am.

1:24 p.m.
DA #15PT966
d.o.b. 06-04-1991
ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. (co-defendant: Joseph Anderlik)

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, Controlled substance, THC.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $1,000 sig bond  with conditions as stated.

BTC: $1,000 sig bond:   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
